title: AFDK build font display problem in InDesign CS4
content:
Hi there  
I have a problem with my Adobe FDK build OTF fonts in InDesign CS4. As you can see, the selection of text is only from the x-height down to somewhere below the baseline. And when change the text, it's size or style the space around the black selection does not change/update. Very annoying. What could be wrong?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203105014im_/http:/typophile.com/files/error_4719.jpg)

Thanks,  
Claus
author: clauses

comments.content: Perhaps the vertical metrics. Is the font's UPM 1000? Have you ran the font through CompareFamily?
That looks like the caret height and refresh problem resulting from a CFF font having a UPM other than 1000. But I thought that had been fixed in CS3?
The UPM is 2048. I haven't run compare family. I will do that tomorrow.

I've just tried Adobe Arabic (which is an OT-CFF font with a 2048 UPM) in InDesign CS4 and saw no selection issues.

Claus, run this command:  
`spot -t head YourFont.otf | grep unitsPerEm`  
What result do you get? unitsPerEm=2048?

`
BigMac:Markant claus$ spot -t head Markant-Regular.otf | grep unitsPerEm
unitsPerEm =2048
`

And damn Typophile won't let me insert an image now, otherwise I could show the vertical metrics from fontQA. That is why I had to paste that illegible mess in the post above.

I think I found the problem. I'm assuming that you're generating the PFA file from FontLab Studio (v5.0.4), yes?

When the font's UPM value is different from 1000, FontLab Studio generates the PFA file with incorrect FontBBox values. The FontBBox values are correctly displayed in the "Key dimensions" pane of the Font Info dialog; but the values in the generated font will be different.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203105014im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PFA_FBBox_3442.png)

For quick workaround, just open the PFA file in a text editor and edit the FontBBox values to match what's displayed by the Font Info.

BTW, CompareFamily quickly pointed me to the reason of the problem. **Single Face Test 15** (Warn if Font BBox x/y coordinates are improbable, or differ between head table and CFF) output the following message:  
**The font bounding box in the hhea table '(-322, -512, 2306, 1798)' differs from that in the CFF table '[-157, -250, 1126, 878]'.**

Hi Miguel  
Thanks a lot for looking into this. It halfway worked, now the rendering updates as it should. The only thing is that the selection still looks like before â€“ that is only colouring from the x-height and down to somewhere below the baseline. This is a minor issue, so let's not waste time on pursuing that.

Claus
